{IERC20-allowance}."},"applyTransactionFee(uint256)":{"params":{"_amountBeforeFee":"The amount the user will receive before transaction fee is applied."},"returns":{"_0":"_amountAfterFee The amount the user will receive with transaction fee applied."}},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-approve}.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-balanceOf}."},"buyDai(uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_deadline":"Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.","_minDaiToReceive":"The minimum amount of DAI the user is willing to receive."}},"buyEcl(uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_deadline":"Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.","_minEclToReceive":"The minimum amount of ECL the user is willing to receive."}},"calcBOut(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"A value of one is subtracted in the _bToReceive calculation to prevent roundingerrors from removing more of the asset from the liquidity pool than intended.","params":{"_aBalance":"The balance of asset A in the liquidity pool.","_aSent":"The quantity of asset A sent to the liquidity pool.","_bBalance":"The balance of asset B in the liquidity pool."},"returns":{"_0":"_bToReceive The quantity of asset B the user would receive before transaction fee is applied."}},"calcEthTransferForBuyEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_ethBalanceOfDaiPool":"The balance of ETH in the DAI liquidity pool.","_ethBalanceOfEclPool":"The balance of ETH in the ECL liquidity pool.","_ethSent":"The quantity of ETH sent by the user in the buyEcl function."},"returns":{"_0":"_ethTransferToDaiPool The quantity of ETH to transfer from the ECL pool to the DAI pool."}},"decimals()":{"details":"Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`).     * Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless {_setupDecimals} is called.     * NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}."},"decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`."},"increaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"name()":{"details":"Returns the name of the token."},"sellDai(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_daiSold":"The amount of DAI the user is selling.","_deadline":"Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.","_minEthToReceive":"The minimum amount of ETH the user is willing to receive."}},"sellEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_deadline":"Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.","_eclSold":"The amount of ECL the user is selling.","_minEthToReceive":"The minimum amount of ETH the user is willing to receive."}},"softSellEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"_deadline":"Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.","_eclSold":"The amount of ECL the user is selling.","_minDaiToReceive":"The minimum amount of DAI the user is willing to receive.","_minEthToReceive":"The minimum amount of ETH the user is willing to receive."}},"symbol()":{"details":"Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name."},"totalSupply()":{"details":"See {IERC20-totalSupply}."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transfer}.     * Requirements:     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`."},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transferFrom}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20};     * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`."}},"title":"The Eclipseum ERC20 Smart Contract"},"userdoc":{"methods":{"applyTransactionFee(uint256)":{"notice":"Calculates the amount for the user to receive with a 0.3% transaction fee applied."},"buyDai(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Allows a user to buy DAI with ETH from the DAI liquidity pool."},"buyEcl(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Allows a user to buy ECL with ETH from the ECL liquidity pool."},"calcBOut(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Calculates amount of asset B for user to receive using constant product market maker algorithm."},"calcEthTransferForBuyEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Calculates the amount of ETH to transfer from the ECL pool to the DAI pool for the buyEcl function."},"circulatingSupply()":{"notice":"Returns the circulating supply of ECL."},"constructor":"The constructor must be called with at least 0.2 ETH.","daiBalanceOfDaiPool()":{"notice":"Returns the DAI balance of the DAI pool."},"eclBalanceOfEclPool()":{"notice":"Returns the ECL balance of the ECL pool."},"ethBalanceOfDaiPool()":{"notice":"Returns the ETH balance of the DAI pool."},"launch()":{"notice":"This function is called once to launch the contract."},"sellDai(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Allows a user to sell DAI for ETH to the DAI liquidity pool."},"sellEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Allows a user to sell ECL for ETH to the ECL liquidity pool."},"softSellEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Allows a user to sell ECL for ETH and DAI to the ECL liquidity pool."}}}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"/C/Users/tbweb/eclipseum-test2/contracts/Eclipseum.sol":"Eclipseum"},"evmVersion":"constantinople","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":false,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"/C/Users/tbweb/eclipseum-test2/contracts/Eclipseum.sol":{"keccak256":"0x37d8d6cd4caef3c9e5cc969719be7a261641fba3a2a2e9cab3735aab6db89399","urls":["bzz-raw://14f2d63e1d5af2636cbfdeb12af10f6f86cdc16c31ddb72e6827aed498643c0f","dweb:/ipfs/QmXCJqpKUKZSYKUqu443boeP4pLwgmRf1oci19UumTWcyx"]},"/C/Users/tbweb/eclipseum-test2/node_modules/openzeppelin-solidity/contracts/GSN/Context.sol":{"keccak256":"0x0de74dfa6b37943c1b834cbd8fb7a8d052e5ff80c7adb33692102dd6cd2985e9","urls":["bzz-raw://9d2d827fcf4a838f5821732c0acd6a40d21c2a5a2cfe2563feec91465f47bb60","dweb:/ipfs/Qmex3wMKf5Sghbfvr288RUg1kP2uAyTMf11w83WbMbpQQc"]},"/C/Users/tbweb/eclipseum-test2/node_modules/openzeppelin-solidity/contracts/math/SafeMath.sol":{"keccak256":"0x04d34b3cd5677bea25f8dfceb6dec0eaa071d4d4b789a43f13fe0c415ba4c296","urls":["bzz-raw://e7e8b526a6839e5ba14f0d23a830387fec47f7043ce01d42c9f285b709a9d080","dweb:/ipfs/QmXmhhFmX5gcAvVzNiDPAGA35iHMPNaYtQkACswRHBVTNw"]},"/C/Users/tbweb/eclipseum-test2/node_modules/openzeppelin-solidity/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0x3211de52f707a62a356a34fdea9d6a7bed46402d5ce45f1891a16fe2132fbb47","urls":["bzz-raw://45dfe794ad43a3674fab38a378c57eb6ed3353949f6529ccad4a4cbc91d45fc5","dweb:/ipfs/QmReFGciE9fgsb6Nas1Fx593pzKWMjaDa1VQg4CEJQaD6U"]},"/C/Users/tbweb/eclipseum-test2/node_modules/openzeppelin-solidity/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0x6cc1cb934a3ac2137a7dcaed018af9e235392236ceecfd3687259702b9c767ad","urls":["bzz-raw://0055fa88138cd1c3c6440370f8580f85857f8fe9dec41c99af9eafbeb8d9c3ce","dweb:/ipfs/QmX1xDh8vwGLLCH8ti45eXjQ7Wcxv1FEGTR3jkFnd5Nv6F"]},"/C/Users/tbweb/eclipseum-test2/node_modules/openzeppelin-solidity/contracts/utils/Address.sol":{"keccak256":"0x5f7da58ee3d9faa9b8999a93d49c8ff9 @notice Returns the circulating supply of ECL.

params._amountBeforeFee: The amount the user will receive before transaction fee is applied.

returns._0: _amountAfterFee The amount the user will receive with transaction fee applied.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

params._deadline: Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.
params._minDaiToReceive: The minimum amount of DAI the user is willing to receive.

params._deadline: Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.
params._minEclToReceive: The minimum amount of ECL the user is willing to receive.

calcBOut(uint256,uint256,uint256).details: A value of one is subtracted in the _bToReceive calculation to prevent roundingerrors from removing more of the asset from the liquidity pool than intended.

params._aBalance: The balance of asset A in the liquidity pool.
params._aSent: The quantity of asset A sent to the liquidity pool.
params._bBalance: The balance of asset B in the liquidity pool.

returns._0: _bToReceive The quantity of asset B the user would receive before transaction fee is applied.

params._ethBalanceOfDaiPool: The balance of ETH in the DAI liquidity pool.
params._ethBalanceOfEclPool: The balance of ETH in the ECL liquidity pool.
params._ethSent: The quantity of ETH sent by the user in the buyEcl function.

returns._0: _ethTransferToDaiPool The quantity of ETH to transfer from the ECL pool to the DAI pool.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`).     * Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless {_setupDecimals} is called.     * NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

params._daiSold: The amount of DAI the user is selling.
params._deadline: Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.
params._minEthToReceive: The minimum amount of ETH the user is willing to receive.

params._deadline: Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.
params._eclSold: The amount of ECL the user is selling.
params._minEthToReceive: The minimum amount of ETH the user is willing to receive.

params._deadline: Epoch time deadline that the transaction must complete before.
params._eclSold: The amount of ECL the user is selling.
params._minDaiToReceive: The minimum amount of DAI the user is willing to receive.
params._minEthToReceive: The minimum amount of ETH the user is willing to receive.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}.     * Requirements:     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20};     * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

applyTransactionFee(uint256).notice: Calculates the amount for the user to receive with a 0.3% transaction fee applied.

buyDai(uint256,uint256).notice: Allows a user to buy DAI with ETH from the DAI liquidity pool.

buyEcl(uint256,uint256).notice: Allows a user to buy ECL with ETH from the ECL liquidity pool.

calcBOut(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Calculates amount of asset B for user to receive using constant product market maker algorithm.

calcEthTransferForBuyEcl(uint256,uint256.notice: Calculates the amount of ETH to transfer from the ECL pool to the DAI pool for the buyEcl function.

circulatingSupply().notice: Returns the circulating supply of ECL.

methods.constructor: The constructor must be called with at least 0.2 ETH.

daiBalanceOfDaiPool().notice: Returns the DAI balance of the DAI pool.

eclBalanceOfEclPool().notice: Returns the ECL balance of the ECL pool.

ethBalanceOfDaiPool().notice: Returns the ETH balance of the DAI pool.

launch().notice: This function is called once to launch the contract.

sellDai(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Allows a user to sell DAI for ETH to the DAI liquidity pool.

sellEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Allows a user to sell ECL for ETH to the ECL liquidity pool.

softSellEcl(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint.notice: Allows a user to sell ECL for ETH and DAI to the ECL liquidity pool.
